lpa_pipeline.associationÔÉÅ

This pipeline running an iterative association test for each snps.

The iterative strategy is as follows:

  • for each the target variable in target_strategy

    1. Extract the column from target_dataset:

    2. run preprocessing, if the value of key preprocessing is given in target_strategy

    3. group the dataset by columns defined by extra_iterate_on if provided

    4. for each group, iterate over columns of encoded_snp (each SNP):

      1. concatenate it with other_exogs, generate the exogenous dataset

      2. if one_to_one_exogs is provided, use one_to_one_strategy finding other columns and concatenate them as well

      3. run regressions specified by target_strategy.engine

      4. combine the results from each SNP

      5. save the regression output

Two APIs provided

  • sklearn style:

    • 3-line style:

      snp_asso = SNPAssociation()
snp_asso.fit(**kwargs)
snp_asso.transform()

    • 2-line style:

      snp_asso = SNPAssociation()
snp_asso.fit_transform(**kwargs)

  • function style:

    snp_asso = SNPAssociation()
snp_asso.association_test(**kwargs_1) #kwargs_1 can be new kwargs

lpa_pipeline.association.encode_dementia(df: pandas.DataFrame) → pandas.DataFrameÔÉÅ

An example preprocessing strategy used in target_strategy,

It should be a callable takes in a pd.DataFrame and returns another one

lpa_pipeline.association.dropna(df: pandas.DataFrame) → pandas.DataFrameÔÉÅ

A simpler preprocessing strategy used in target_strategy

It should be a callable takes in a pd.DataFrame and returns another one

lpa_pipeline.association.filter_c(df: pandas.DataFrame, threshold=5) → pandas.DataFrameÔÉÅ

The filter C on existing frequency,

both 0 and 1 should appear for more than <threshold> times

Parameters:

  • df ‚Äì pandas DataFrame, the index should be the Sample ID, and the columns are the snps

  • threshold ‚Äì int, the number threshold that both 0 and 1 should appear more than this number

lpa_pipeline.association.target_strategy() → Dict[str, Dict[str, Union[statsmodels.api.Logit, statsmodels.api.OLS, Callable]]]ÔÉÅ

An example target_strategy used in the association analysis

The key for main dict is the variable name The value is a dict with the following keys:

‚Äúengine‚Äù, whose value is a statsmodels model

‚Äúpreprocessing‚Äù, whose value is a callable takes in a pd.DataFrame and returns another one

lpa_pipeline.association.target_strategy_serum() → Dict[str, Dict[str, Union[statsmodels.api.Logit, statsmodels.api.OLS, Callable]]]ÔÉÅ

An example target_strategy used in the serum analysis

class lpa_pipeline.association.SNPAssociationÔÉÅ

a class for running SNP association pipeline

debug_log(*args) → NoneÔÉÅ

only print the result when it‚Äôs in verbose mode == 2

fit(encoded_snp: pandas.DataFrame, other_exogs: pandas.DataFrame, target_dataset: pandas.DataFrame, target_strategy: Dict[str, Dict[str, Union[statsmodels.api.Logit, statsmodels.api.OLS, Callable]]], output_path: str, snp_alias: str = 'variant', one_to_one_exogs: Optional[pandas.DataFrame] = None, one_to_one_strategy: Optional[Callable] = None, one_to_one_alias: Optional[str] = None, na_strategy: str = 'drop', group_na_strategy: str = 'snp_wise', extra_iterate_on: Optional[list] = None, snps_preprocessing_strategy: Optional[Callable] = None, verbose: int = 0) → NoneÔÉÅ

API setting up the regression (not running)

Parameters:

  • encoded_snp ‚Äì pd.DataFrame, the dataframe to be looped on columns

  • other_exogs ‚Äì pd.DataFrame, the dataframe taking all the other variables

  • target_dataset ‚Äì pd.DataFrame, the dataframe taking all the target variables

  • target_strategy ‚Äì

    dict[str, dict[str, funcs or models]], The dictionary provide pre-processing to specific column, Only column mentioned in keys will be included in the running. The inner dictionary should have two keys:

    ‚Äùengine‚Äù: statsmodels.api models

    designed for statsmodels.discrete.discrete_model.Logit or statsmodels.regression.linear_model.OLS, but any model‚Äôs .fit results provide .params .bse .pvalues will work

    ‚Äùpreprocessing‚Äù: funcs

    the function should take a pd.DataFrame/pd.Series as input and a pd.DataFrame/pd.Series as output, If this strategy is None, the column will be used as exogenous variables as-is

  • output_path ‚Äì str, the output root path, the saving name will be printed for reference

  • snp_alias ‚Äì Optional[str], the name used for snp column in output DataFrame

  • one_to_one_exogs ‚Äì Optional[pd.DataFrame], the dataframe providing specific exog variable based on encoded_snp

  • one_to_one_strategy ‚Äì Optional[funcs], when given a snp name, this function should output the corresponding one_to_one_exogs column name

  • one_to_one_alias ‚Äì Optional[str]: the name used for one-to-one variables in output DataFrame

  • na_strategy ‚Äì

    Optional[str], the strategy statsmodels dealing with NAs, Available options are ‚Äònone‚Äô, ‚Äòdrop‚Äô, and ‚Äòraise‚Äô.

    If ‚Äònone‚Äô, no nan checking is done.

    If ‚Äòdrop‚Äô, any observations with nans are dropped.

    If ‚Äòraise‚Äô, an error is raised.

  • group_na_strategy ‚Äì Optional[str], how na_strategy apply when have extra_iterate_on, can be ‚Äúsnp-wise‚Äù or ‚Äúgroup-wise‚Äù, it‚Äôs working for status when na_strategy == ‚Äúdrop‚Äù

  • extra_iterate_on ‚Äì Optional[list], the list of extra iterate variable in other_exog please be noticed that it may cause severe explosions in running time

  • snps_preprocessing_strategy ‚Äì Optional[funcs], the preprocessing applied to snps before the regression analysis this function should take a pd.DataFrame as input and output

  • verbose ‚Äì

    Optional[int] in {0,1,2} default 0

    if verbose == 0, no output will be printed except the progress bar

    if verbose == 1, the regression will give the saving path

    if verbose == 2, the regression will output all the related values during the computation, only for debugging purpose, use with care for it will create massive I/O

transform(output_path: str = None, verbose: int = None) → DictÔÉÅ

API Run the actual association test

Parameters:

  • output_path ‚Äì Optional[str]: if provided, only in this run, it will cover the output_path previously provided

  • verbose ‚Äì Optional[int]: if provided, only in this run, it will cover the verbose previously provided

fit_transform(**kwargs)ÔÉÅ

API run fit and transform in one method

_get_column_name(col: List[str]) → List[str]ÔÉÅ

for a list of given column, generate suffix necessary as header

generate a file name

generate an info dictionary for a regression task

_save_association_result(result: pandas.DataFrame, info: Dict[str, Union[str, int, List[str]]], output_path: str, verbose: int)ÔÉÅ

save result and info to output path as the name specified in info

_calculate_freq(df: pandas.DataFrame, cols: str) → Tuple[float, int, int]ÔÉÅ

given a pandas.dataFrame <df> and specific column name <cols>, compute the frequency

Please note that this is only designed for 0/1 or boolean column When using quantitative value the freq it‚Äôs not making realistic sense, So the computing is awkward‚Ä¶ just want to keep the code running even with quantitative columns. Feel free to override it.

Parameters:

  • df ‚Äì pd.DataFrame, a data table

  • cols ‚Äì str, column name in df

Returns:

tuple containing

  • float: the relative frequency of 1s in this column.

  • float: the number of 1s in the column.

  • float: the number of rows in the column.

_association_snp(snp_table: pandas.DataFrame, other_exogs: pandas.DataFrame, endog: Union[pandas.DataFrame, pandas.Series], engine: Callable, one_to_one_exogs: Optional[pandas.DataFrame] = None, one_to_one_strategy: Optional[Callable] = None, one_to_one_alias: List[str] = None, snps_preprocessing_strategy: Optional[Callable] = None, na_strategy: str = 'drop', group_na_strategy: str = 'snp_wise', snp_alias: str = 'variant', extra_label: Optional[Tuple[List[str], List[Hashable]]] = None) → Tuple[pandas.DataFrame, Dict]ÔÉÅ

association test designed for snp variants analysis

For each column in snp_table, run an individual <endog>~column+<other> on <engine> return the beta/weight/effect size, standard error and p-values

Parameters:

  • snp_table ‚Äì pd.DataFrame, the table encoding snps, the columns is snp name, rows are individuals, values are numerics

  • other_exogs ‚Äì pd.DataFrame, the table encoding other traits, the columns is traits, rows are individuals, values are numerics

  • endog ‚Äì pd.DataFrame or pd.Series, the target/endogenous variable

  • engine ‚Äì statsmodels models, most of the time it‚Äôs statsmodels.discrete.discrete_model.Logit or statsmodels.regression.linear_model.OLS, but any model‚Äôs .fit results provide .params .bse .pvalues will work

  • one_to_one_exogs ‚Äì pd.DataFrame, the dataframe providing specific exog variable based on encoded_snp

  • one_to_one_strategy ‚Äì funcs, when given a snp name, this function should output the corresponding one_to_one_exogs column name

  • one_to_one_alias ‚Äì list[str], the name used to take the one-to-one column

  • snps_preprocessing_strategy ‚Äì Optional[funcs] the preprocessing applied to snps before the regression analysis this function should take a pd.DataFrame as input and output

  • snp_alias ‚Äì str, the name used for snp column

  • na_strategy ‚Äì Optional[str], stands for the strategy dealing with NAs, Available options are ‚Äònone‚Äô, ‚Äòdrop‚Äô, and ‚Äòraise‚Äô. If ‚Äònone‚Äô, no nan checking is done. If ‚Äòdrop‚Äô, any observations with nans are dropped. If ‚Äòraise‚Äô, an error is raised. Default is ‚Äònone‚Äô.

  • group_na_strategy ‚Äì Optional[str], how na_strategy apply when have extra_iterate_on, can be ‚Äúsnp-wise‚Äù or ‚Äúgroup-wise‚Äù, it‚Äôs working for status when na_strategy == ‚Äúdrop‚Äù

  • extra_label ‚Äì Optional[tuple[tuple[str], tuple[str]]]

Returns:

tuple containing

  • pd.DataFrame: the effect size, se and p-values for each <endog>~column+<other> on <engine>.

  • dict: additional information that is included.

association_test(encoded_snp: pandas.DataFrame, other_exogs: pandas.DataFrame, target_dataset: Union[pandas.DataFrame, pandas.Series], target_strategy: Dict[str, Dict[str, Union[statsmodels.api.Logit, statsmodels.api.OLS, Callable]]], output_path: str = '', one_to_one_exogs: Optional[pandas.DataFrame] = None, one_to_one_strategy: Optional[Callable] = None, one_to_one_alias: str = None, na_strategy: str = 'drop', extra_iterate_on: List[str] = None, group_na_strategy: str = 'snp_wise', snps_preprocessing_strategy: Optional[Callable] = None, snp_alias: str = 'variant', verbose: int = 0) → DictÔÉÅ

API running regression test

Parameters:

  • encoded_snp ‚Äì pd.DataFrame, the dataframe to be looped on columns

  • other_exogs ‚Äì pd.DataFrame, the dataframe taking all the other variables

  • target_dataset ‚Äì pd.DataFrame, the dataframe taking all the target variables

  • target_strategy ‚Äì

    dict[str, dict[str, funcs or models]], the dictionary provide pre-processing to specific column. Only column mentioned in keys will be included in the running. The inner dictionary should have two keys:

    • ‚Äùengine‚Äù: statsmodels.api models,

      designed for statsmodels.discrete.discrete_model.Logit or statsmodels.regression.linear_model.OLS, but any model‚Äôs .fit results provide .params .bse .pvalues will work

    • ‚Äùpreprocessing‚Äù: funcs

      the function should take a pd.DataFrame/pd.Series as input and a pd.DataFrame/pd.Series as output, This strategy is None, the column will be used as exogenous variables as-is

  • output_path ‚Äì str, the output root path, the saving name will be printed for reference

  • one_to_one_exogs ‚Äì pd.DataFrame, the dataframe providing specific exog variable based on encoded_snp

  • one_to_one_strategy ‚Äì funcs, when given a snp name, this function should output the corresponding one_to_one_exogs column name

  • one_to_one_alias ‚Äì str, the name for one_to_one settings

  • snps_preprocessing_strategy ‚Äì Optional[funcs] the preprocessing applied to snps before the regression analysis this function should take a pd.DataFrame as input and output

  • na_strategy ‚Äì Optional[str], stands for the strategy dealing with NAs, Available options are ‚Äònone‚Äô, ‚Äòdrop‚Äô, and ‚Äòraise‚Äô. If ‚Äònone‚Äô, no nan checking is done. If ‚Äòdrop‚Äô, any observations with nans are dropped. If ‚Äòraise‚Äô, an error is raised. Default is ‚Äònone‚Äô.

  • extra_iterate_on ‚Äì Optional[list], the list of extra iterate variable in other_exog please be noticed that it may cause severe explosions in running time

  • group_na_strategy ‚Äì Optional[str], how na_strategy apply when have extra_iterate_on, can be ‚Äúsnp-wise‚Äù or ‚Äúgroup-wise‚Äù, it‚Äôs working for status when na_strategy == ‚Äúdrop‚Äù

  • snp_alias ‚Äì Optional[str], the name used for snp column

  • verbose ‚Äì Optional[int] in {0,1,2} default 0 if verbose = 1, the regression will give the saving path if verbose = 2, the regression will output all the related values during the computation, only for debugging purpose, use with care for it will create massive I/O

Returns:

a dict recording output brief information

Return type:

dict
